addressleaf.section:
To my L. T
re
r Sep
t
9 1591

Belgia
1591 9 Sep
t
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. I can not certifie
as yet, howe
Count Maurice
hath spedde in the
enterprise of
Hulst.
For there is nothing yet
written to
e
Councel of state
: and I trust yo
w
are informed of some that are present, and may
sooner advertise. It is nowe, as we conjecture,
that they doe execute their purpose: but o
r
hope
at
e Hage is muche diminished, for
at the Enemie
we heare, was forwarned of their comming.
There hath bin lately some treaty between
e
General states
and
e Lady of
Anholt
of
e
house of Battenbourgh, that her towne of Anholt
in
e Countie of
Zutphen,
upon
e frontiers towardes
Cleveland,
w
ch
hath alwaies hitherto taken part
w
t
e Enemie, might heereafter be permitted to
keepe it self neutral. The states at her inst
a
ce
will yelde unto it, upon condition that an other
place of strength adjoining to Anholt, and be-
longing to
e said Lady, w
ch
is called
Brede-
noord
, or Breefoort, and steedeth
e Enemie more
then
e other, may hold
e same neutrallitie.
Whiles this motion is in treaty, above 4 daies
agoe,
Captaine Lambert
w
t
certaine Englishe
companies of
Duisbourgh,
not knowing, as I
suppose, what mater was in hand, upon cer-
taine intellgence w
t
some
their
in
Garrison
Anholt
,
went soddainly thither, scaled
e wales, and
possessed
e towne: w
ch
was done w
t
some
the
losse
of some fower of
e souldiers. But
e towne
hath a castel of greater strength, w
ch
they cold
not
e
ter.
fo
The next day after
at
e
towne was tak
e
certaigne Englishe m
e
of
e
better sort
were found missing
am
o
g w
ch
were
e two brothers
of
S
r
Francis Vere
: w
ch
were knowen to be
there
when
e Alarme was giv
e
, but not to be
found
when
e towne was tak
e
. This was
[written]
e next day after: but sins I heard no more. The towne was hardly worthe
e taking, for that it was full of poore people, and not to be held against
e Enemie.
And because they had a parle about a neutrallitie, I knowe not w
at
they will resolve,
about
e keeping or ab
a
don
i
g of it. The Enemie lieth still in his former
places
.
But all o
r
advertism
e
ts signifie,
at he goeth for
France
e end of this moneth .
Sep
t
9 1591
